body: The Big City column last Sunday, about a small waterfront neighborhood on the western tip of Coney Island, in Brooklyn, rendered the name of the location incorrectly. It is Sea Gate, not Seagate. The error was repeated in an accompanying picture caption.
title: Corrections

body: A few months ago, I received a letter from someone whose business card, included in his envelope and containing only a small fraction of his résumé, described him as a trained lawyer, educator, speaker, boxing journalist and, perhaps most significant, a historian of Seagate. Occupying the western tip of Coney Island, in Brooklyn, Seagate is a
title: BIG CITY; Beach Town Of Eclectics
